bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Florence M. Read, March 5, 1925

div1.p: Carter informs Read that Henry Rose Carter has completed two months of work on his History of Yellow Fever, and encloses an itemized account of expenses.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Florence M. Read, March 5, 1925
div1.opener:
Book
expenses.
/LC
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
March 5, 1925.
Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
1: As per instructions from yourself and Dr. Russell, I am writing
this to let you know that Father has completed two more months work on
the History of Yellow Fever--i. e. January and February, 1925.

2: I am also enclosing the itemized account of the expenses incurred
in connection with writing the above History, since last summer.

Father is working all day and every day and I know you will be
delighted with the result. It is literature, as well as science and
history, if he is “one of my family!”
With very best remembrances from us both, I remain
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, Laura A. Carter 1 enclosure.
